attributes.action: Lower the price of parking permits for residents in Hillingdon and elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: This has come to my concern as people with driveways have a extra parking space so dont need to pay as much but residents who do not have to pay extra for a permit. I would like the Goverment to change the prices of parking permits because me and my family live in a walkway in the borough of Hillingdon and many houses around us have driveways. My family have to pay £110 a year just to park on the road they live in and can bearly afford that so other familys must be in the same position as mine too.
attributes.background: The Goverment need to change the prices of parking permits as my family can bearly afford anything because of the cost of living. I would like the Goverment to change the price to £20 max per permit as £75+ is way too much for a family like mine.

rejection.details:
We are sorry to hear about your situation, but we can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local parking permits are a matter for your local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your council directly: https://modgov.hillingdon.gov.uk/mgePetitionListDisplay.aspx?bcr=1
